metadata.Title: CVE-2023-38408 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: The PKCS#11 feature in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 9.3p2 has an insufficiently trustworthy search path, leading to remote code execution if an agent is forwarded to an attacker-controlled system. (Code in /usr/lib is not necessarily safe for loading into ssh-agent.) NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-10009.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> openssh-ssh1 is provided for compatibility with old devices that cannot be upgraded to modern protocols. Thus we may not provide security support for this package if doing so would prevent access to equipment.

criterions.comment: openssh package in fips/focal is affected and may need fixing.
openssh-ssh1 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
